intro: Panicularia scabrella, commonly known as the rough panicled grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the grass family Poaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant produces pale green to yellowish flowers, which are typically arranged in panicles, giving it its common name. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Panicularia scabrella is adapted to arid environments and is known for its resilience to drought conditions.
